RE: [10366187]  -  TAS001 August corrections
,
I will review the list and action any items that are related to the integration logic.
However not all the errors or open items are related to integration errors.
Often these errors occur because of missing or incorrect data - in this case, the local team need to review, correct in Workday and close the events in HRX.
I think we need to discuss this process if there are any questions. I'm very happy to support if there are integration defects, but for data, the corrections should be applied locally and the events closed locally.
Below is a summary of a few of the open items, that are not related to integration logic errors, but data and NGA or Securex actions.
I will raise the items for NGA/Securex directly with them.

Light Gallery Issues  -  Amounts not showing up in payslips
Signify Classified - Internal
Hi team,
We are having numerous cases where customers do not see the tax benefit back in their payslips after purchasing something from the Light Gallery.
Light Gallery supposedly sends a file to you in order to process certain amounts as a tax benefit if I am not mistaken. So not sure where it is going wrong.
As an example (other than the two you already got from Anja) Alberta Zawadzka payroll number is 89000673. Light Gallery confirmed that they were manually filled in to be sent to NgA the 29th August. Not sure if that necessarily means it should be paid out in September but good to check if you received anything?

Return the completed Employee Separation Checklist and attached documents, with a copy of the Employee's Resignation Letter (if applicable), to the HR Service Center within 24 hours of the employee's last date worked.

Dear Employee,
Your application for parental leave has been approved.
You will find the approved application form attached.
The leave will be allocated in accordance with the conditions specified in the attachment and our policy on  MyASML.
The payroll and time-keeping departments are hereby requested and authorised to handle the administrative aspects of your leave.
You receive a confirmation letter from PME.
PME has also send a form to fill-out your pension accrue choice.
Please return this form to PME and make sure your choice matches the choice you communicate to us.
PME needs this form for legal obligations.
For more information please check the website of PME.
Extension of your parental leave
If you wish to extend your parental leave, please complete the 'Special leave of absence' CTL form at least two months prior to the end of the initial period of parental leave.
On September 3, 2020 you have 621 hours of parental leave left for your child Dimittris (9/4/2019).
These remaining hours can be used until your child turns 8 years old.
After your parental leave
After the end of your parental leave the same number of working hours is applicable as before your parental leave.
If you wish to start working part time or to change your part-time percentage on your return to work, please complete and sign the  Change of WorkscheduleForm and return it to us at least two months prior to the end of your parental leave.
We will send you written confirmation of receipt of your request.
For more information you are welcome to contact undersigned.

AstraZeneca Switzerland July 2019 Pay Instruction
Dear Team,
We have uploaded the July '19 payroll instruction file for the IA population in the Switzerland folder in EY Delivers. This can be accessed using the below link:
https://de.eyd.ey.com/sites/4u16w82hcmxw/Switzerland/2019/07.%20Jul/01.%20Pay%20instruction
This payroll instruction is based on the compensation data we have received from AZ GM and the other information we have been provided over the last 6 weeks by the local HR and payroll teams.
In case of any questions regarding this, please contact us at AstraZenecaGCS@uk.ey.com
What do you need to do?
- Pleaseprocess the pay instruction through your payroll system (if available).
- Please provide us with the output results in form of a simulation / system output file / payslip after processing the payroll instruction using this link:
https://de.eyd.ey.com/sites/4u16w82hcmxw/Switzerland/2019/07.%20Jul/02.%20Payroll%20output
Please Note:
- We have included in the correction lines relating to Jan 2019 for assignee "20182710" in the current(July2019) month.
- Please upload Payroll Output files to EYD only in the below given URL without any password. We will not be accepting any files via email as per GDPR policy.
What do you need to consider?
Please note below while processing the payroll instructions through the payroll system.
- In the "to be processed" tab column Q states which items are to be paid to the assignee ("Pay") and which items are not to be paid ("No Pay"). Those items are for reporting purposes only. Where applicable tax items would be flagged as Taxes in col Q.
- Please note, that the net pay only includes all balance sheet payments provided to us by the AstraZeneca. If there are local payments being made through the payroll which are not included in the payroll instruction, then those would not be included in the net pay stated by EY. In these cases the net pay will differ from the EY pay instruction to the payslip accordingly. The logic we have applied for deduction codes is that they are appearing as negative. If your payroll system has the codes set up as deduction please reverse and import these payments as a positive amount to ensure the assignee is deducted accordingly.
How to read the pay instruction?
The payroll instruction file has 4 tabs, information is detailed below:
- Summary - breakdown of the total net pay and taxes to be paid over to the tax authorities
- To be processed - detailed breakdown of all payments contained within the payroll instruction
- Net Pay - breakdown by assignee of individual net pay
- Key - IMPORTANT, this provides information on how to process each column within the to be processed tab of the payroll instruction
What are the deadlines?
The deadline for processing these instructions and to provide the results (payslips and payroll system report) is by 31st July 2019.
Please do not hesitate to reach out to us immediately in case of any questions or queries.

AstraZeneca Switzerland July 2019 Pay Instruction
Dear Team,
We have uploaded the July '19 payroll instruction file for the IA population in the Switzerland folder in EY Delivers. This can be accessed using the below link:
https://de.eyd.ey.com/sites/4u16w82hcmxw/Switzerland/2019/07.%20Jul/01.%20Pay%20instruction
This payroll instruction is based on the compensation data we have received from AZ GM and the other information we have been provided over the last 6 weeks by the local HR and payroll teams.
In case of any questions regarding this, please contact us at AstraZenecaGCS@uk.ey.com
What do you need to do?
- Pleaseprocess the pay instruction through your payroll system (if available).
- Please provide us with the output results in form of a simulation / system output file / payslip after processing the payroll instruction using this link:
https://de.eyd.ey.com/sites/4u16w82hcmxw/Switzerland/2019/07.%20Jul/02.%20Payroll%20output
Please Note:
- We have included in the correction lines relating to Jan 2019 for assignee "20182710" in the current(July2019) month.
- Please upload Payroll Output files to EYD only in the below given URL without any password. We will not be accepting any files via email as per GDPR policy.
What do you need to consider?
Please note below while processing the payroll instructions through the payroll system.
- In the "to be processed" tab column Q states which items are to be paid to the assignee ("Pay") and which items are not to be paid ("No Pay"). Those items are for reporting purposes only. Where applicable tax items would be flagged as Taxes in col Q.
- Please note, that the net pay only includes all balance sheet payments provided to us by the AstraZeneca. If there are local payments being made through the payroll which are not included in the payroll instruction, then those would not be included in the net pay stated by EY. In these cases the net pay will differ from the EY pay instruction to the payslip accordingly. The logic we have applied for deduction codes is that they are appearing as negative. If your payroll system has the codes set up as deduction please reverse and import these payments as a positive amount to ensure the assignee is deducted accordingly.
How to read the pay instruction?
The payroll instruction file has 4 tabs, information is detailed below:
- Summary - breakdown of the total net pay and taxes to be paid over to the tax authorities
- To be processed - detailed breakdown of all payments contained within the payroll instruction
- Net Pay - breakdown by assignee of individual net pay
- Key - IMPORTANT, this provides information on how to process each column within the to be processed tab of the payroll instruction
What are the deadlines?
The deadline for processing these instructions and to provide the results (payslips and payroll system report) is by 31st July 2019.
Please do not hesitate to reach out to us immediately in case of any questions or queries.

Please note that in euHReka, by Corning request, we switched to the French label as the Payslips must be written in French on Payslips (Legal).
-
- Reformulation of the Corning request
The request concerns wagetypes that are existing with the same codes and labels in EC-HRX and euHReka but for which different values are expected.
On Employee central Corning manage the above wagetypes that are sent to HRX Exchange.
However Corning want to manage a different value between EC-HRX and euHReka. The expected process is:
- The WT values are not transferred to euHReka
- Corning Team opens ticket to request to upload the values expected in euHReka
-
- Change and Concern raised by the Corning request
The Corning request is technically possible: the 11 WT are configurated in the integration table HRX-euHReka "To be skipped". Then the data is not recorded in euHReka.
The cost is 1 day: 0,5 day technical changes - 0.5 day testing
Please note that we need to understand the frequency of the entries in euHReka expected to evaluate the cost.
Our main concern is the data master policy.
On HRX model, HRX is master and euHReka PY is slave.
The policy to manage directly data in euHReka is when the WT do not exist in HRX.
That means Corning will have a structural Gap between the values associated to codes between 2 systems, assuming the slave solution (euHReka)
-
- Alternative approach
The NGA logic is to have Corning recording data in EC or on HRX directly. And then it flows to euHReka. The policy is to respect the logic HRX Master, euHReka Slave for data.
The proposal is to create in HRX a copy of the existing WT but with a different code. EC file is set up to point on this new code.
We map EC with a new WT code in HRX
We use the existing WT code in HRX when Corning wants to enter value for Payroll.

[ID:10166215] Employee Separation Notification - ACTION REQUIRED
Dear Haruka,
Eva Anderson, 1582691 has been/will be separated from employment with Boston Scientific Corporation or one of its subsidiaries on  Aug 03, 2019.
As the Supervisor you are responsible for meeting with the terminating employee on or before their last day of work to review and complete the following documents.  In addition, you are expected to return the completed documents to the HR Service Center within 24 hours of the last date worked:
- Employee Separation Checklist(Attached).  Review and complete every item on the checklist, and sign and date the form.
- Copy of Signed Employee Agreement(Agreement Concerning Employment) (Attached)..
- Duplicate Employee Agreement Receipt Form(Attached). If a copy of the signed Employee Agreement is not attached, please have the employee sign the Confidentiality and Propriety Information Reminder Form (also attached).
- Questionnaire Regarding Document Retention and Preservation(Attached).
- Personal Contact Information Sheet(Attached).  Return this form only if the employee's home address and/or telephone number needs to be updated. The employee's final check(s) and other documents will be sent to the home address on file.
(Please be informed that all the above documents are automatically password protected and the password will be send to you in a separate auto generated email)
If the employee refuses to sign, or is not available to sign any of these documents, please note this on both the document and the Separation Checklist.
Return the completed Employee Separation Checklist and attached documents, with a copy of the Employee's Resignation Letter (if applicable), to the HR Service Center within 24 hours of the employee's last date worked.
Email: HRConnectUSHR@bsci.com or FAX: 1-866-732-2165.
If you have questions regarding this process please contact the HR Service Center at 1-800-570-4455.

[ID:10134796] Employee Separation Notification - ACTION REQUIRED
Dear Justin,
Nicholas Gaeth, 1556826 has been/will be separated from employment with Boston Scientific Corporation or one of its subsidiaries on  Jul 29, 2019.
As the Supervisor you are responsible for meeting with the terminating employee on or before their last day of work to review and complete the following documents.  In addition, you are expected to return the completed documents to the HR Service Center within 24 hours of the last date worked:
- Employee Separation Checklist(Attached).  Review and complete every item on the checklist, and sign and date the form.
- Copy of Signed Employee Agreement(Agreement Concerning Employment) (Attached).
- Duplicate Employee Agreement Receipt Form(Attached). If a copy of the signed Employee Agreement is not attached, please have the employee sign the Confidentiality and Propriety Information Reminder Form (also attached).
- Questionnaire Regarding Document Retention and Preservation(Attached).
- Personal Contact Information Sheet(Attached).  Return this form only if the employee's home address and/or telephone number needs to be updated. The employee's final check(s) and other documents will be sent to the home address on file.
Also find the attached:
- Termination Package
(Please be informed that all the above documents are automatically password protected and the password will be send to you in a separate auto generated email)
- Benefits Vendor Contact Information. Please click on this link and print the current document:  https://secure.bscbenefitsconnect.com/us/includes/Vendor%20Contact%20Information.pdf
If the employee refuses to sign, or is not available to sign any of these documents, please note this on both the document and the Separation Checklist.
Return the completed Employee Separation Checklist and attached documents, with a copy of the Employee's Resignation Letter (if applicable), to the HR Service Center within 24 hours of the employee's last date worked.
Email: HRConnectUSHR@bsci.com or FAX: 1-866-732-2165.
If you have questions regarding this process please contact the HR Service Center at 1-800-570-4455.

Information Classification: llPersonal Sensitive Data
Dear Kelly,
Conor Dawson (IFDS employee based in Luxembourg) is overpaid since May 1st, 2019 because of a salary issue in Workday.
Could you please urgently correct the salary retroactively as of May 1st, 2019 with the following figure: 57000 euros gross/year (cf. Ticket attached)?
Please note that in Luxembourg we are paid on a 13th month basis and this is probably the reason of this issue in the first place.
For our country, Workday has been set up like that: if you enter a gross annual salary of 57000 euros, then the following calculation will be done by the system = 57000 / 12 months * 13 months = 61750 euros. This last figure is visible as "total salary & allowances" and comes out in our payroll report. For Conor, we should see 57000 euros as Total Salary & Allowances in order to pay him correctly.
And therefore his monthly gross salary should be 57000/13 = 4384.615 euros.
I have already created a ticket for the correction but as it is an urgent issue (overpayment since several months), I was advised to send you directly an email to accelerate the process.

Information Classification: ll Limited Access
Hi,
The ticket [TICKETID:10207200] was closed. I still need your assistance on the below
1. Please log in into the T&A System.
2. The Quick Find menu will be available as default. Enter an asterisk (*) followed by the employee's name or employee ID into the search bar to find the employee.
3. Select the correct signed off pay period for the edit. Click Enable Edits from the Approval drop-down list.
4. Click Yes to Enable Edits.
5. Select Go To - Timecards in the right hand corner.
6. To enter a Pay Code that covers a part of a day:  Click on the + symbol on the day you need to enter the Pay Code. Click the Pay Code field and select from the drop down list. Click the Amount column and enter a number of hours (to designate the time). Depending on the edit, you may need to modify the Pay Code or the Amount or both. Proceed to Step 10.
7. To enter a Pay Code that covers a full day:  Remove Start time and End time on the day you need to enter the Pay Code. Click the Pay Code field and select from the drop down list. Click the Amount column and enter 1 (to designate a full day absence). Depending on the edit, you may need to modify the Pay Code or the Amount or both. Proceed to Step 10.
8. To modify a leave entry: Click on the + symbol on the day you need to correct the pay code. Select the required pay code from the drop down list in the pay code column. Click the Amount column and enter negative 1 or negative 0.5 (to designate full or half day), or a negative number of hours (i.e. -8 hours) Proceed to step 10.
9. To edit Punch: Click directly into the cell to enter the adjusted start or end time. Proceed to Step 10.
10. Click Save.
11. Click Yes to save details.
12. Place your cursor on the edited pay code; a callout indicates Historical Correction.

Sinead
Parental Leave Approval
Hi Sinead,
Usually the leave types have an estimate return date on SF, however, I don't see any active leave on SF for you.  Can you confirm that your parental leave has been taken from your wages every month since March please?
Parental Leave Approval
Hi Sinead,
Yes, that is correct.  The Service Centre will update records to reflect comments made.
Parental Leave Approval
Susan,
I started by parental leave on Friday March 1st until August 30th 2019.
My plan is to take 4 hours per week (Fridays off)
Can you please clarify if this is how Orla should complete the EAF:
Leave start date (highlighted) Friday March 1st 2019
Expected return date (highlighted)  August 30th 2019
Comments . marked in Blue x - 4 hours per week parental leave between period above.
Parental Leave Approval
Yes that is correct - Sinead is taking 4 hours of parental leave a week.  You can put that in the comments section.
Please note that Susan is your HRBP so you should route the EAF to her.
Parental Leave Approval
Do I just reduce her working hours to 35 hours/week?  Sinead is not going out on leave, she is just working 4 less hours per week and I want to make sure I do this right.  I'm not clear on what to do.
Parental Leave Approval
HI Orla
This applies to all leave including Parental leave, you are asked to select the appropriate leave.
Parental Leave Approval
Orla/Sinead,
This file you sent me shows how to adjust somebody when they go on leave of absence.  Sinead is not going on leave of absence, she is working 4 less hours per week over the next 6 months at least.
Can you advise how to show 4 hours per week leave.  The details you sent do not show that or at least I'm not reading that.

Hi Orla
Please see attached the downloaded versions.
Parental Leave Approval

Thanks for these, please complete an EAF for this leave.  This is the job aid link for same:  https://jam4.sapjam.com/groups/mAuycxavbRaMGCBajFttJc/documents/GW1OBSJbmv7SKBDd98p8Mn/slide_viewer?_lightbox=true

Let me know if you have any questions on same.

Orla,
Please find attached 3 pages ref parental leave for Sinead Shanley.  I am approving this leave per details attached.
The attachments include:
-
- Birth cert
- Form A parental leave request from Sinead
- Form B (I've filled in) - approval for Parental leave which I've signed
I should have submitted these a few weeks back so apologies for the backdating.

Hi Team,
Please respond no later than August 9th, 2019.
Along with the information typically noted in our quarterly vest email please review the bullet points noted below:
·       Notify the Equity Administration Team if you have had any changes to your banking details since the May 15th vesting or if you have a specific payroll deadline for this upcoming vest.
·       Along with validating tax rates - please validate the employees on the attached file are within your countries payroll systems.
·       In the attached spreadsheet pleaseonlyupdate the cells highlighted in yellow. Any further manipulation of the file could result in the proper tax rate not being used.
Attached is a file with employees who have shares vesting on August 15th. This vesting will include the processing of Deferred Stock Awards (DSA), SSGA LTIP Awards, and Deferred Value Awards (DVAs). We have included anestimate of the income that will be realized for each employee upon vesting. This is calculated using an estimated stock price and estimated FX rate - this is only provided so that it may help with the tax rate confirmation prior to the vest date. These valueswill change upon the final vesting and shouldNOT be used to process. Final income information will be provided after the vesting has been completed.
Deferred Stock Award process:
All employees worldwide will be processed as a 'withhold to cover'. In this transaction, the Company will retain enough of an employee's vesting shares to satisfy their personal tax obligation and employees will receive the net shares in their brokerage account. In a withhold to cover process, the same price is used to calculate an employee's income and tax obligation as well as to determine the amount of shares needed to cover the tax obligation.
In order to comply with strict accounting standards for global equity plans, we must insure that the tax withholding rate for each employee is based on the minimum required tax withholding rate under local tax rules. If no tax withholding is required then the rate is 0. If the minimum required tax withholding is based on year-to-date earnings then you will need to incorporate this into the rate provided.
SSGA LTIP & Deferred Value Awards:
Similar to the vesting of other equity types, State Street will need to withhold the appropriate amount of taxes and the Equity Administration group will wire the tax withholding to the employees respective payrolls for the appropriate withholding and reporting. These tax rates could differ from the tax withholding rates for DSA's. The net cash payments will be deposited into employees Fidelity accounts.
As a reminder, for all awards we withhold taxes in a particular location using a universal rate that has been supplied to us by KPMG. We have supplied a listing of employees from your payroll that are vesting in August, along with the current KPMG rate that has been provided. For each employee, please confirm the correct actual minimum required rate withheld in order to comply with local tax regulations. PLEASE NOTE: The calculation used to determine the shares needed to satisfy an employee's tax obligation usually results in a fractional amount of shares. Since the Company can only withhold whole amounts, the fractional amount is rounded up resulting in a small portion of extra funds being withheld. This amount is added to the taxes.
In agreement with Steffen please correct his tax to 27% instead of 55% and make sure it is included in the salary of August

Below is the base formula
Leave encashment is calculated based on the formula below.
[Monthly Gross Salary (fixed pay less retirals) x 12] / [246 (For a 9 hours shift) or 252 (For a 8 hours shift)] * No. of days of leave to be encashed (subject to a maximum of 22 days carry forward from the previous year).
